biz.gabrys.lesscss.compiler2.filesystem

Class ClassPathFileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • biz.gabrys.lesscss.compiler2.filesystem.ClassPathFileSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FileSystem

    public class ClassPathFileSystem
extends Object
implements FileSystem

    Represents a file system accessible via class path (classpath protocol).

    Example paths:

    • classpath://style.less
    • classpath://styles/main.less
    Since:
    2.0.0

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        public void configure(Map<String,String> parameters)
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Configures this file system. This method is called only once after the file system has been created.
        Specified by:
        configure in interface FileSystem
        Parameters:
        parameters - the map with parameters (cannot be null).

      • isSupported

        public boolean isSupported(String path)
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Tests whether a file path is supported. This method should return true only when this file system allows to do all operations:
        • normalize file paths
        • expand file paths redirections
        • checking if files specified by paths exist
        • fetch files data
        Specified by:
        isSupported in interface FileSystem
        Parameters:
        path - the path to verify (never null).
        Returns:
        true whether the file path is supported, otherwise false.

      • normalize

        public String normalize(String path)
                 throws URISyntaxException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Normalize a path. A normalized path is an absolute path where at least:
        1. all "." segments are removed
        2. if ".." segment is preceded by a non-".." segment then both of these segments are removed.
        Examples:
        • C:\Users\less\style.less
        • /home/user/less/style.less
        • http://www.example.org/style.less
        Specified by:
        normalize in interface FileSystem
        Parameters:
        path - the path to normalize (never null).
        Returns:
        the normalized path (never null).
        Throws:
        URISyntaxException
        See Also:
        FileSystem.isSupported(String)

      • expandRedirection

        public String expandRedirection(String path)
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Returns a direct normalized path to a resource. Example: if a path is equal to "http://example.org/style.less", but this URL forwards to "/static/style.less", then the method will return "http://example.org/static/style.less".
        Specified by:
        expandRedirection in interface FileSystem
        Parameters:
        path - the normalized file path (never null).
        Returns:
        the direct normalized path to the resource (never null). If the path is already a direct path, it should return that path.
        See Also:
        FileSystem.normalize(String)

      • exists

        public boolean exists(String path)
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Tests whether a direct normalized file path point to an exiting file.
        Specified by:
        exists in interface FileSystem
        Parameters:
        path - the direct normalized file path (never null).
        Returns:
        true whether the direct file path point to an exiting file, otherwise false.
        See Also:
        FileSystem.expandRedirection(String)

      • fetch

        public FileData fetch(String path)
               throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Returns a data of the file specified by a path.
        Specified by:
        fetch in interface FileSystem
        Parameters:
        path - the direct normalized file path (never null).
        Returns:
        the file data (never null).
        Throws:

        See Also:

      • getClassLoader

        protected ClassLoader getClassLoader()
        Returns the context ClassLoader for the currently executing thread object. The reason why this method has been extracted is allow stubbing and mocking class loader objects in tests.
        Returns:
        the context ClassLoader.
        Since:
        2.0.0
